title: Celebrities who own islands [Photos]
text:
Wednesday, July 22, 2015 08:00 AM EDT Celebrities who own islands Previous Next 
Johnny Depp Aegean Sea island, Greece: Johnny Depp is among the celebrities who are snapping up Greek islands. Depp has reportedly purchased an island in the Aegean Sea for 4.2 million euros. The government of Greece is selling off 50 billion euros in assets as part of a bailout plan - including 1,200 to 6,000 islands. Get the full story here . (WENN.com) 
Nicholas Cage Leaf Cay, Bahamas: Cage reportedly scooped up this island in 2006 for $3M. The actor loves the Bahamas and also owns a house on Paradise Island. (HRC/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: HRC/ WENN.com 
David Copperfield Musha Bay aka The Islands of Copperfield Bay, Bahamas: The famous magician bought the island in 2007 for $15M. With resorts and rental units the private getaway could be yours for $3,700 a night. Apart from the crystal clear waters and private beaches, Copperfield claims the island is also home to the fountain of youth. (Judy Eddy/WENN.com) Judy Eddy/WENN.com 
Johnny Depp Little Halls Pond Cay, Bahamas: The actor purchased the island in 2004 for a reported $3.6M. The 45-acre island includes six beaches which he recently revealed are named after his children and former girlfriend Vanessa Paradis, and friends; Marlon Brando, Hunter S. Thompson and Heath Ledger. (WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: WENN.com 
Leonardo DiCaprio Blackadore Caye, Belize: DiCaprio purchased this 104-acre piece of paradise in 2005, the reported costs run from $1.75M to $2.4M. DiCaprio says he’d like to turn it into an eco-friendly island and resort. (WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: WENN.com 
Celine Dion Ile Gagnon, Quebec: Unlike other celebrities the Canadian crooner stuck to her roots, however the house she custom-built in 2001 recently went on the market. The 24,000 sq. ft. ‘Chateau’ on the 830,000 sq. ft. island is on the market for $29.7M. (Judy Eddy/WENN.com) Judy Eddy/WENN.com 
Mel Gibson Mago Island, Fiji: Gibson bought this island for a cool $9M in 2005. It is said to be one of the largest privately-owned islands in the South Pacific. Unlike other celebs, Gibson has left most of the island untouched except for a small getaway residence for himself. (FayesVision/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: FayesVision/WENN.com 
Lenny Kravitz Eleuthera, Bahamas: With Bahamian roots, Kravitz frequently visited the Bahamas before buying a small island in the Eluthera chain. (Rui M Leal/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Rui M Leal / WENN.com 
Ricky Martin Angra dos Reis, Brazil: Martin bought an Island on Angra dos Reis in 2008 for $8M. It was reported the singer shopped around the Caribbean and Latin America before making this big purchase. (Andres Otero/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Andres Otero/ WENN.com 
Faith Hill and Tim McGraw Goat Cay, Bahamas: The country power couple purchased the island in 2006 and have since completed their own 15,000 sq. ft. vacation home on the island. (Starbux/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Starbux/WENN.com 
Tyler Perry White Bay Cay, Bahamas: It’s reported that Perry bought the Bahamian island for his 40th birthday in 2009. It is also said to be the director’s second island which he hopes to turn into a private resort spot. (Andres Otero/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Andres Otero/ WENN.com 
Shakira Bonds Cay, Bahamas: Shakira and Pink Floyd’s Roger Waters bought this 700-acre Bonds Cay island in 2006 for $16M. They plan to turn it into a vacation resort. (Digital Creations/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Digital Creations/WENN.com 
Steven Spielberg Madeira, Portugal: The award-winning director is said to own an island in Madeira. It’s reported to have a vacation residence used just by his family. (Brian To/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: Brian To/WENN.com 
Robin Williams Pender Harbour, British Columbia: Not much was known about Williams' little piece of Canada, but the deceased comedian and actor was never shy about his love for everything Canadian, so it's no surprise the beloved actor would buy a place north of the border. (C.Smith/WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: C.Smith/ WENN.com 
Richard Branson Moskito Island and Necker Island, British Virgin Islands: The Virgin founder bought Necker Island first in 1978 for a reported 178,000 Euros (about $270,000). Branson built ‘The Great House’ a private and luxurious getaway that rents up to $54,000 a day. The property suffered fire damage in 2011, but has been repaired. Branson later bought Moskito (or Mosquito) Island in 2007 for a reported $10M, he early stated he wishes to build an Eco-friendly resort there. (CARMINE MARINELLI/Postmedia Network) 
Eddie Murphy Rooster Cay, Bahamas: The comedian spent $15M for this island just a short boat-ride away from Nassau in 2007. It was reported Murphy also owned another Bahamian property called The Pearl before purchasing the island. (HRC/ WENN.com) Mandatory Credit: HRC/ WENN.com 
Ekaterina Rybolovleva Skorpios Island, Greece: Rybolovleva, the 24-year-old daughter of a Russian billionaire, purchased this Greek resort island where shipping tycoon Aristotle Onassis famously married Jacqueline Kennedy in the 1960s, for an undisclosed amount. Reports put the value of the isle at $100 million. (WENN.com) 
It always seems celebrities have it all -- and this list won't dispute that. Here is a list of celebs who own their own islands. Kim Kardashian and North West Turtle Island, Australia: In November 2014, The Daily Mail reported the reality TV star was in talks to buy Turtle Island off the coast of Queensland for $5 million for her daughter with Kanye West, North West. Kardashian reportedly has plans to build a theme park for North on the island, to compliment the isle's already existing three-bedroom house. (WENN.com) 
Heidi Klum Tavern Island, Connecticut: Heidi Klum is considering buying an $11 million island off the coast of Connecticut. A report from the New York Post says Klum is interested in the 3.5 acre island, which has views of New York City, a six-bedroom Tudor mansion, boat house, private beach and a pool. The isle was previously owned by New York entertainer Billy Rose. (WENN.com) Article
